Imports

basictypes, geometry, cameras, transformation, materials

Types

AABoundingBox = ref object
  pmin*: Point
  pmax*: Point
An axis alligned bounding box defined by two vertices in the 3D space. 
AABox = ref object of Shape
  pmin*: Point
  pmax*: Point
An axis alligned box defined by two vertices in the 3D space. 
Cylinder = ref object of Shape
  r*: float
  z_min*: float
  z_max*: float
  phi_max*: float
A 3D cylinder lateral surface alligned with z axis. 
HitRecord = ref object
  world_point*: Point
  normal*: Normal
  surface_point*: Vec2d
  t*: float
  ray*: Ray
  material*: Material
An object holding information about a ray-shape intersection The parameters defined in this dataclass are the following:
  • world_point: a Point object holding the world coordinates of the hit point
  • normal: a Normal object holding the orientation of the normal to the surface where the hit happened
  • surface_point: a Vec2d object holding the position of the hit point on the surface of the object
  • t: a floating-point value specifying the distance from the origin of the ray where the hit happened
  • ray: the ray that hit the surface
Plane = ref object of Shape
A 3D infinite plane parallel to the x and y axis and passing through the origin. 
PointLight = object
  position*: Point
  color*: Color
  linear_radius*: float
A point light (used by the point-light render). It represents a Dirac's delta in the rendering equation. If linear_radius is non-zero, it is used to compute the solid angle subtended by the light at a given distance d through the formula (linear_radius/d)^2 
Shape = ref object of RootObj
  transformation*: Transformation
  material*: Material
  bound_box*: AABoundingBox
A generic 3D shape This is an abstract class, and you should only use it to derive concrete classes. Be sure to redefine the method .Shape.rayIntersection. 
Sphere = ref object of Shape
A 3D unit sphere centered on the origin of the axes. 
World = object
  shapes*: seq[Shape]
  point_lights*: seq[PointLight]
A class holding a list of shapes, which make a «world» You can add shapes to a world using .World.add. Typically, you call .World.rayIntersection to check whether a light ray intersects any of the shapes in the world.

    tags: [].}
Iterate over the entire list of shapes and check if there are any intersection with ray. 
proc sphereNormal(point: Point; ray_dir: Vec): Normal {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Compute the normal of a unit sphere. The normal is computed for point (a point on the surface of the sphere), and it is chosen so that it is always in the opposite direction with respect to ray_dir. 
proc spherePointToUV(point: Point): Vec2d {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Convert a 3D point on the surface of the unit sphere into a (u, v) 2D point.
